adjective.description: Of, belonging to, or characteristic of the extinct family Platysomidae of palaeoniscoid fishes, known from fossil remains of the Carboniferous, Permian, and Triassic periods, and generally having a deep, vertically flattened body.

noun.description: A fish of the family Platysomidae.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in American Naturalist. From scientific Latin Platysomidae, family name from Platysomus, genus name + -idae.
